summary: bran is always going to win a staring contest. when everyone else has to blink, he can just continue staring with his third eye....
body:
bran is always going to win a staring contest. when everyone else has to blink, he can just continue staring with his third eye. there’s really not much of a competition here.

spoiler: and that’s how he’s going to defeat the night king.

A blog dedicated to Jaime/Brienne from aSoIaF and GoT.
Occasionally to other characters, friendships or romances. We are two bloggers involved in this project.

summary: Bran already knows everything.  He’s right, Jaime wouldn’t had the opportunity to know Brienne, save her, send her to save...
caption:
Bran already knows everything.

He’s right, Jaime wouldn’t had the opportunity to know Brienne, save her, send her to save Sansa, come to Winterfell. Nor the chance to prove himself as honorable, nor to see himself as a true knight. His cruelest act produced some of his best actions.

reblog.comment:
Bran already knows everything.

He’s right, Jaime wouldn’t had the opportunity to know Brienne, save her, send her to save Sansa, come to Winterfell. Nor the chance to prove himself as honorable, nor to see himself as a true knight. His cruelest act produced some of his best actions.

He’s right, Jaime wouldn’t had the opportunity to know Brienne, save her, send her to save Sansa, come to Winterfell. Nor the chance to prove himself as honorable, nor to see himself as a true knight. His cruelest act produced some of his best actions.

tags: this is where the dead walk
summary: Fear cuts deeper than swords, the quiet voice inside her whispered. Suddenly Arya remembered the crypts at Winterfell. They were...
body:
Fear cuts deeper than swords, the quiet voice inside her whispered. Suddenly Arya remembered the crypts at Winterfell. They were a lot scarier than this place, she told herself. She’d been just a little girl the first time she saw them. Her brother Robb had taken them down, her and Sansa and baby Bran, who’d been no bigger than Rickon was now. They’d only had one candle between them, and Bran’s eyes had gotten as big as saucers as he stared at the stone faces of the Kings of Winter, with their wolves at their feet and their iron swords across their laps.

Robb took them all the way down to the end, past Grandfather and Brandon and Lyanna, to show them their own tombs. Sansa kept looking at the stubby little candle, anxious that it might go out. Old Nan had told her there were spiders down here, and rats as big as dogs. Robb smiled when she said that. “There are worse things than spiders and rats,” he whispered. “This is where the dead walk.” That was when they heard the sound, low and deep and shivery. Baby Bran had clutched at Arya’s hand.

When the spirit stepped out of the open tomb, pale white and moaning for blood, Sansa ran shrieking for the stairs, and Bran wrapped himself around Robb’s leg, sobbing. Arya stood her ground and gave the spirit a punch. It was only Jon, covered with flour. “You stupid,” she told him, “you scared the baby,” but Jon and Robb just laughed and laughed, and pretty soon Bran and Arya were laughing too.

— AGOT, Arya IV

reblog.comment:

trail.content:
Fear cuts deeper than swords, the quiet voice inside her whispered. Suddenly Arya remembered the crypts at Winterfell. They were a lot scarier than this place, she told herself. She’d been just a little girl the first time she saw them. Her brother Robb had taken them down, her and Sansa and baby Bran, who’d been no bigger than Rickon was now. They’d only had one candle between them, and Bran’s eyes had gotten as big as saucers as he stared at the stone faces of the Kings of Winter, with their wolves at their feet and their iron swords across their laps.

Robb took them all the way down to the end, past Grandfather and Brandon and Lyanna, to show them their own tombs. Sansa kept looking at the stubby little candle, anxious that it might go out. Old Nan had told her there were spiders down here, and rats as big as dogs. Robb smiled when she said that. “There are worse things than spiders and rats,” he whispered. “This is where the dead walk.” That was when they heard the sound, low and deep and shivery. Baby Bran had clutched at Arya’s hand.

When the spirit stepped out of the open tomb, pale white and moaning for blood, Sansa ran shrieking for the stairs, and Bran wrapped himself around Robb’s leg, sobbing. Arya stood her ground and gave the spirit a punch. blog.name: epicallyepicepicosity2
blog.title: Epically Epic Epicosity
blog.description: Denver, CO (displaced New Yorker) - Uber geek, prog-rock fan, hockey fan, food fan, ample redhead fan, Democrat, husband and father. EXTREMELY Anti-Trump since 1983. My blog is slightly schizophrenic, and NSFW within acceptable post-Tumbpocalypse parameters. Disclaimer: Content is mined elsewhere, rarely original. Please dm if content is exclusive, and will remove immediately. Where all my censored blogs go: https://epicallyepicepicosity.blogspot.com/

body:
Theory

Bran has a vision in season 4 episode 2. A dragon is flying over kings landing and the throne room is covered in snow because the ceiling has been destroyed. What if the night king goes to kings landing while the battle of winterfell is taking place. The night king would believe that his army can easily over take winterfell, and he can go take kings landing where no one is prepared. One thing is, shouldn’t Bran remember this vision? Unless he’s so into his “I’m the three eyed raven” that vision has escaped him.
